description: Restricts MariaDB server to listen only on localhost interface, preventing unauthorized remote access unless explicitly needed for deployment.
Disables LOCAL INFILE option to prevent clients from loading local files onto the server, mitigating risks of unauthorized file access and data exfiltration.
Prevents loading of user-defined functions without proper init/deinit symbols, reducing risks from malicious or faulty UDFs that could compromise server security.
Disables general query logging in production to avoid performance overhead while maintaining security through other logging mechanisms.
Reduces priority of MariaDB process to minimize impact on system performance during high load.
